IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Under the sponsorship of the Sisters of Mercy of Americas-Northeast Community and as a member of Catholic Health East, Mercy Health System of Maine is dedicated to providing quality and compassionate care to those in need and their families, with special concern for the poor and disadvantaged.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Under the sponsorship of the Sisters of Mercy of Americas-Northeast Community and as a member of Catholic Health East, Mercy Health System of Maine is dedicated to providing quality and compassionate care to those in need and their families, with special concern for the poor and disadvantaged.
IRS990.Description: Support and coordinate the provision of healthcare services by Mercy Hospital, VNA Home Health & Hospice, other healthcare facilities and direct providers of healthcare serving the greater Portland area.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: As part of the compensation plan, executives receive a discretionary spending account for certain eligible expenses incurred. Payments of these expenses are made on a grossed-up basis.
The organization has and follows a written policy regarding payment or reimbursement for provision of the expenses on Line 1a.

Part I, Line 3: Mercy Health System of Maine relied on a related organization (Catholic Health East) that used one or more of the methods described below to establish the top management official's compensation: - Compensation committee - Independent compensation committee - Written employment contract - Compensation survey or study - Approval by the board or compensation committee. Part I, Line 4a: Katherine Coolidge received notice and serverence pay in the amount of 36,808 due to a management restructure in 2010. Part I, Line 4b: The following individuals received taxable SERP payments: Wayne Bennett - $22,804; Michael Hachey - $25,602; Robert Nutter - $24,740; Colleen Hilton - $14,420; Eileen Skinner - $96,262. Part I, Line 7: Company compensation programs include various incentive/bonus programs where fixed payments measured in terms of a percentage of base salary may be made in relation to performance or goal achievements.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Yes, Catholic Health East is the sole member of Mercy Health System of Maine.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Yes, Catholic Health East is the sole member of Mercy Health System of Maine. Catholic Health East approves all members of the Board of Directors of Mercy Health System of Maine.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Yes, Catholic Health East has reserved powers in the following areas: changes in Articles of Incorporation; in key By-laws provisions, appoint and remove Board of Directors; adopt philosophy and mission, consolidated strategic plan, consolidated operating plan and budget, adopt and authorize significant financial transactions and significant budget variances and establishment or dissolution of organizational relationships.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board of Directors has delegated review authority for the Mercy Hospital and Mercy Health System of Maine (MHSM) Form 990 returns to the MHSM Finance and Audit Committee (Finance Committee). The Finance Committee conducted a thorough review of the draft Form 990 returns and approved them. Subsequently, the Board of Directors reviewed the Form 990 returns during the October Board meeting. These documents were mailed to the members approximately one week prior to each meeting to allow adequate time for individual member review. Time was allotted to have a final copy of the returns emailed to Board members subsequent to the October Board meeting if it was revised. This would provide the Board of Directors the ability to review the returns prior to submission to the IRS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Mercy Health System of Maine Attachment A to the bylaws sets forth the organization's conflict-of-interest policy and processes. Annually, all those serving Mercy Health System of Maine in a fiduciary capacity, including directors, officers, non-Board committee members and key employees receive a copy of the policy and annual disclosure statement to be completed. Disclosures of financial interest or other reportable circumstances as defined in the policy are submitted and reviewed by the organization's Chairman of the Board and Compliance Officer. Summary information is reported to the Governance Committee and entire Board. This is available to the Board throughout the year as business comes before the Board or management for action. The policy contains a continuing affirmative obligation on all affected individuals to disclose compensation or other circumstances throughout the year which may rise to the level of an actual or apparent conflict. The determination of whether a disclosed financial or other interest constitutes a conflict of interest is made by the Board or an appropriate committee thereof comprised of dis-interested persons and without the participation of the affected individual except to respond to questions about the disclosure. The policy further addresses the procedure for the Board's further consideration of the proposed transaction/matter without the participation of the affected person and the documentation of the proceedings. Lastly, the policy addresses potential disciplinary action for violations of the policy. The policy is available to the public upon request.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Mercy Health System of Maine's process for determining compensation includes the following: The Board has an independent committee review and approve all elements of remuneration for all disqualified parties, as well as other key management. The Board/committee has an established compensation philosophy which details the objectives of market positioning and pay elements. The committee engages with external consultants to provide market data comparing Mercy Health System of Maine roles to similarly sized health systems utilizing both title and job content comparisons. The committee reviews the market analysis, approves any salary adjustments for the executive and employed physician populations, considers both reasonableness and effectiveness of all remunerative programs and establishes the performance expectations which are incorporated into the incentive plan. All of these discussions and decisions are documented through the provision of meeting minutes.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Organizational articles of incorporation, corporate bylaws, governance policies, conflict of interest policy, and audited financial statements are available upon request. IRS Form 990 for Mercy Health System of Maine is published on the Mercy Hospital website.

Individuals compensated by a related organization have responsibilities and perform services for several organizations within the health system. The amount of compensation appearing in Columns (E) and (F) reflect the services performed for the entire health system as a whole and not merely a single organization within the health system.
